abstract_summ: Methods: In this study, COVID-19 disease outcomes (confirmed cases, deaths and recoveries), testing capacities and disease management approaches among African countries were evaluated.In recent months, despite being aware of the COVID-19 pandemic, many countries faced increasing epidemic of this disease.We conclude that COVID-19 elimination requires more control measures than what is currently being applied inWest-Africa and that mass testing and contact tracing in order to identify and isolate asymptomatic individuals early is very important in curtailing the burden of the pandemic.Background: Following the declaration of COVID-19 as a global pandemic and the report of index case in Africa, the number of countries in Africa with confirmed cases of the infection has grown tremendously with disease now being reported in almost all countries on the continent, with the exemption of Lesotho after 75 days.Combining two or more measures is better for disease control, e.g., if asymptomatic humans are contact traced or identified and isolated in less than 3 days then only about a 31% reduction in the disease transmission rate is required for disease elimination.
title_summ: Understanding Economic and Health Factors Impacting the Spread of COVID-19 DiseaseHuman food consumption patterns concerning COVID-19 pandemicPredicting COVID-19 spread and public health needs to contain the pandemic in West-AfricaUnderstanding the Collective Responses of Populations to the COVID-19 Pandemic in Mainland ChinaWeathering the pandemic: How the Caribbean Basin can use viral and environmental patterns to predict, prepare and respond to COVID‐19Critical medical ecology and SARS-COV-2 in the urban environment: a pragmatic, dynamic approach to explaining and planning for research and practiceGlobal Ranking of COVID-19-Related Mortality by Country using a Novel Pandemic Efficiency Index (PEI)Protective Population Behavior Change in Outbreaks of Emerging Infectious DiseaseRich at risk: socio-economic drivers of COVID-19 pandemic spreadPreliminary evaluation of COVID-19 disease outcomes, test capacities and management approaches among African countries.
title_abstract_phrases: Human food consumption patterns concerning COVID-19 pandemicIn recent months, despite being aware of the COVID-19 pandemic, many countries faced increasing epidemic of this disease.Methods: In this study, COVID-19 disease outcomes (confirmed cases, deaths and recoveries), testing capacities and disease management approaches among African countries were evaluated.Background: Following the declaration of COVID-19 as a global pandemic and the report of index case in Africa, the number of countries in Africa with confirmed cases of the infection has grown tremendously with disease now being reported in almost all countries on the continent, with the exemption of Lesotho after 75 days.Specifically, this study has identified potential COVID-19 under-reporting traits as well as various economic factors that impact COVID-19 Diagnosis, Reporting, and Treatment.We conclude that COVID-19 elimination requires more control measures than what is currently being applied inWest-Africa and that mass testing and contact tracing in order to identify and isolate asymptomatic individuals early is very important in curtailing the burden of the pandemic.
